Dear Families,

Thank you for your continued support and trust in Phoenix Union. The health, safety, and wellness of your student remains our top priority.

Although we cautiously allowed sports conditioning this summer, community spread of COVID still far exceeds state and county benchmarks outlining the safe return to school. In order to maintain the safety of our student-athletes and coaches, we have decided to postpone all in-person sports practices and competition until it is safe to do so. The attachment to this email provides more information regarding this decision.

We are also fully aware that sports is not the only important activity that connects and engages our students. Performing and Fine Arts, JROTC, clubs, and many other programs are critically important to both our staff and students. Once state and county health benchmarks are met, we will also consider the safe return of these important activities.

Thank you again for your continued commitment to your child‚Äôs education. Please contact your school with questions or if you are in need of any support.

Congratulations to Trevor G. Browne graduate Daniel Hernandez who was awarded the John Sutter Memorial Scholarship by the Phoenix Guitar Societyüéâ‚ú®

He was the only guitar student in #PXU to receive the Arizona Arts Seal. Daniel also participated in The Aboda Guitar Festival and lead the TGB Advanced Guitar Ensemble toward receiving a Superior with Distinction Rating. He also participated with other TGB players in the PGS sponsored Sonoran Desert Guitar Festival in Oct of 2019.

Daniel graduated from TGB in May, and will be going into the National Guard and will attend ASU in the Fall after basic training. #ThisIsWhoWeAre

‚ÄúVictims‚Äù had simulated injuries such as broken bones, lacerations and heart attacks, which can commonly be found in car accidents. post_text: STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT: Over the summer, more than 115 seniors from Bioscience High School, Phoenix Coding Academy, Trevor Browne High School, Franklin Police & Fire Academy, Central High School and Cesar Chavez High School participated in the 3-day, 6th Annual Liftoff to College event, hosted by College Depot at the Burton Barr Main Phoenix Library. This combined College Application Campaign featured presentations by over 20 speakers, ranging from all in-state public universities to three centrally located MCCCD colleges (Phx College, GateWay Community College, and South Mtn. Community College), as well as sessions on financial aid, Year Up Arizona, scholarships and the Common Application. The event was held last Wednesday-Friday, July 31st-August 2nd. By Friday, many students had already received a letter of acceptance and congratulations from Northern Arizona University! #PXU #ThisIsWhoWeAre
